newsitem.title: BELGIUM: BT says Dutch telecoms venture is alive.
newsitem.headline: BT says Dutch telecoms venture is alive.

text.p: British Telecommunications Plc's alliance with a Dutch rail firm to bid for a telecoms licence in the Netherlands still stands and will be re-notified to the European Commission for clearance, a BT Brussels spokesman said.
The spokesman told Reuters that the withdrawal of the first notification was "purely technical" and that a fresh request would be filed by the end of November.
The Dutch government is to decide by January 9, 1997, on the winners of two licences to build and operate national fixed-line public telephone networks.

BT, together with Dutch state-owned firm Nederlandse Spoorwegen, has bid for one of the licences. Other competitors are Global One, an alliance between France Telecom, Deutsche Telekom and Sprint Corp of the United States, and a consortium of Dutch energy firms called Enertel.
